font.b: In an effort to prevent the further spread of coronavirus in Oklahoma, the Oklahoma State Board of Education has mandated that all Oklahoma school buildings remain closed for the rest of the school year. Students will resume with distance learning methods beginning April 6.

span.span: We are collecting photos of our seniors to honor them with a digital slideshow showcasing their accomplishments and achievements. We would like photos of our seniors in their prom dresses, caps and gowns, holding signs with their future plans, college choices, and scholarships, awards and honors. To accomplish this, we need photos from our community. Please send them by email or share them via google drive to Jennifer Pinkerton at jpinkerton@caneyvalleyschool.org.
We need photos submitted by May 1st. Thank you!

a.aria-label: Read more about Senior Digital Slideshow

div.p: Parents: Please remember to email your middle school child's course requests to dmoses@caneyvalleyschool.org as soon as possible. We are working on class placements for the 2020-2021 school year and need to know who is planning to take which classes.
Thank you, Diane Moses

h3.a: AT&T's Commitment to Helping Customers Stay Connected

div.p: Now more than ever, it’s important to have access to the Internet to stay in-touch with family, friends, work, healthcare providers, retailers, and school. That’s why AT&T will continue to offer affordable ways to connect. Households with at least one resident who participates in the Supplemental Nutritional Assistance Program (SNAP), and in California only, Supplemental Security Income (SSI) recipients, may qualify.
There is NO annual commitment, NO deposit, NO installation fee and NO charge for an in-home Wi-Fi ® capable modem.
Additionally, in response to the public health crisis1, Access from AT&T is temporarily:

ul.li: Offering two months of free service, $5/mo. or $10/mo. plus taxes and fees thereafter, depending on your speed, for new customers who order Access by April 30, 2020.
Expanding eligibility based on income2 and to households participating in National School Lunch Program/Head Start
Waiving all home internet data overage fees

div.p: Feel free to share our updated program information with your community. Please consider:

ul.li: Including flyers from our partner portal in your communication:
Checklist of Information Needed to Complete Application﻿
Ordering free copies of our updated preprinted flyers from the printing portal, attaccess.rrd.com

div.p: See the above linked flyers or go to att.com/access to learn more about Access from AT&T. Please also sign into our partner portal, accesspartners.att.com, to browse our COVID-19 specific promotional and communications materials. For assistance beyond our online resources, please call 1-855-220-5211.
In a united effort, thank you for choosing us,
AT&T

a.aria-label: Read more about AT&T's Commitment to Helping Customers Stay Connected

span.span: Caney Valley staff have put together a list of resources for students and families. This list will cover resources for all grade levels. Please contact the school or your student's teacher if more information is needed.

a.aria-label: Read more about eResources for Learning

div.p: Athletic physicals will be the week of May 4-8, 2020. Every student participating in athletics for the 2020-2021 must have a physical completed by a doctor. Spring physicals will be given at Dr. Leatherman's office (previously Caney Valley Medical Clinic) in Ramona. Please call the clinic at 918-536-1024 to make an appointment. Students may go at any time during the week of May 4th with an appointment. Physicals will be $10 during that time period. After May 8th, physicals will be $40. Physical packets may be copied from the website or you may pick up a packet at Dr. Leatherman's office.

h3.a: Parent Packet Pickup Instructions for CV MS Students

p.b: Parent Packet pickup instructions:
Where: Middle School/High School campus only. Sorry, my plan was to have a pickup at both campuses but it just didn’t work out.

Pickup will be drive-thru only. Enter the parking lot from the East side (one way). Pull up by the stage entrance. You will see the tables. Please do not get out of your vehicle. State the students name and grade. If needed, the food pick up will be further down by the cafeteria. If food is not needed just exit the line and parking lot by the admin building.
Please clearly state: Name and grade: 1 at a time for whomever you are picking a packet up for.
Grades: Yes, grades can and will improve with every assignment that is turned back in.
Turn in: If possible please take a picture and email it to your teachers weekly. All work has to be turned in by the 8th of May.
Building entry: Not available at this time

We are not currently letting anyone in the building, however, please call the MS office if your child has something essential that they must have. Everything else will need to wait until a later date. If you are picking up medicine please email me or call the office and we will have it ready for you during pick up times.
Library books: if you have them at home you can drop them off at pick up.

Let’s try to be positive through this process. Please share this and call anyone that might not see this post. Let's come together as a community and help each other out. Contact me if other arrangements need to be made.
A special thanks to:

span.b:
Ramona Bank of Oklahoma: for helping copy packets.
Dollar General: for donating bags
Teachers for all their hard work. Thank you for caring about our students.
The community, parents, and students for being supportive and patient.

p.b: Sincerely,
Mr. Scheihing

a.aria-label: Read more about Parent Packet Pickup Instructions for CV MS Students

span.span: Starting Monday all classes for high school credit will be available online. Your child can log into their school gmail account to start their work. All teachers will be checking email daily if your child has questions.
If your child has something at school they need please contact the high school and we will schedule a time for someone to come to the building to retrieve it. This will be by appointment only.

If your child does not have access to the internet please contact the high school office at (918) 536-3425 and a packet with their work will be delivered to your home as soon as possible. This packet will contain their work for the remainder of the school year. It will be due the week of May 4th through the 8th. At that time you can contact the school and arrangements will be made to pick it up.

a.aria-label: Read more about Distance Learning HS Letter

h3.a: Caney Valley Elementary’s plan for the Distance Learning

div.p: Dear Parents,

We hope this letter finds you well and safe. I know many of you are anxiously awaiting the details of Caney Valley Elementary’s plan for the Distance Learning that must take place for the remainder of this school year. I wanted to have a solid plan in place before revealing it to the parents in order to avoid mass confusion!

All grades, PreKindergarten through 5th grade will receive packet work. The packet work is not specific to the homeroom teacher, but to the grade level. For example, all 2nd graders will receive the same packet, regardless of homeroom teacher. This will streamline our distribution process, as well as allow students to have access to multiple grade level teachers if needed for assistance. While we are providing packet work, there will also be online content available for those that have internet access. Online access is not mandatory, so please do not worry if you are unable to participate online. Grade levels may also be utilizing any of the following to remain in contact: Facebook groups, Remind, Zoom, Class Tag, email, etc., to name a few. Each teacher will also have office hours each day where you can contact them for any questions/concerns you may have. You may contact them outside of those office hours via email and they will get back to you in a timely manner.

We will begin the distribution of packets on Monday, April 6. This will occur in a drive-thru pickup at the elementary in two different time slots: 9:00-11:00 am, and then from 3:00-5:00 pm. Please enter the parking lot and take the CAR LOOP. Once you are at the front of the line, a staff member will approach your vehicle. Please provide your student(s) names and grade levels. Those packets will have undergone 3 days of quarantine and will be delivered to your car in bags with staff following all CDC guidelines. PLEASE DO NOT EXIT YOUR CAR FOR ANY REASON. At this time, we will only be handing out packet work. If your child has prescription medication that needs to be picked up, please call the office before you arrive and we will have those ready to hand out with your packet. If you are unable to make either pickup time, please call the office at 918.535.2205 or email me at klongan@caneyvalleyschool.org. The office will be open for calls Monday through Friday, from 8:00-11:00 am.

Once we have been able to successfully hand out all student learning packets, we will begin devising a plan for the pickup of student belongings. We will handle that pickup by appointment at a later date. Teachers have been working on creating learning packets in the very limited time they have been allowed in the buildings, so they have not started gathering and bagging your child’s items. We will work to have those ready for pickup in the next few weeks! Thanks for your understanding!

If you have any questions, please feel free to contact me at klongan@caneyvalleyschool.org. We sure miss seeing our students every day, but know that this is what is best for everyone's health and safety!
Sincerely,

Kelli Longan
CVE Principal

a.aria-label: Read more about Caney Valley Elementary’s plan for the Distance Learning

h3.a: Coronavirus Disease 2019-2020 (COVID-19) and other Communicable Diseases

p.b:
CANEY VALLEY SCHOOL
P.O. Box 410
Ramona, Oklahoma 74061 ·
(918) 536-2500
March 11, 2020
Dear Caney Valley Public School Community and Patrons:

Regarding the Coronavirus Disease 2019-2020 (COVID-19) and other communicable diseases, we believe it is best to be prepared with preventative, containment and management measures. The health, well-being, and safety of our students, staff, and families are of utmost importance. Therefore, it is essential to pass on safety precautions that the district will carry out have been advised and/or instructed by state and federal agencies.

We understand this is a global virus and there are confirmed cases within the United States to include Oklahoma. Per the Center for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC), "COVID-19 is a new disease which we are learning how it spreads, the severity of illness it causes and to what extent it may spread in the United States."

What we have been advised by the CDC is that if an individual who is exposed to the virus then contracts it, symptoms show within 2-14 days. The symptoms include – fever of 100.0 degrees or higher; shortness of breath; and cough. For more information, please access the CDC's website which is updated daily: http://www.cdc.gov/coronavirus/2019-ncov/travelers/index.html.

According to the CDC, contraction is mainly through person-to-person contact via respiratory droplets but, “it may be possible that a person can get COVID-19 by touching a surface or object that has the virus on it and then touching their own mouth, nose or possibly their eyes, but this is not thought to be the main way the virus spreads." Therefore, we are increasing the frequency of our cleaning and disinfectant practices within the schools.

If any of our Caney Valley School community members have recently traveled or intend to travel to a level 2 or 3 countries then those individuals should self-quarantine from our schools for 14 days upon return to help reduce the potential spread of the virus. Please be advised this also applies to our community members that will be traveling to Level 2 and Level 3 countries during Spring Break (March 16-20, 2020). For an updated list of current Level 2 and 3 countries, as determined by the CD https://www.cdc.gov/coronavirus/2019-ncov/travelers/index.html.
STEPS FOR RETURNING TRAVELERS FROM Level 2 or Level 3 COUNTRIES, per the CDC.

1. Take your temperature with a thermometer two times a day and monitor for fever. Also, watch for a cough or trouble breathing.
2. Stay home and avoid contact with others. Do not go to work or school for this 14-day period. Discuss your work situation with your district before returning to work or school.
3. Do not take public transportation, taxis, or ride-shares during the time you are practicing social distancing.
4. Avoid crowded places (such as shopping centers and movie theaters) and limit your activities in public.
5. Keep your distance from others (about 6 feet).

District employees may use available sick leave during the 14-day self-quarantine period. Students will be addressed on a case-by-case basis. Please communicate individual needs with your school principal. If a staff member or student has been exposed to COVID-19, contact the Washington County Health Department, a (918) 335-3005 and your physician.
Please continue to exercise good hygiene practices washing hands, avoid touching face, do not share drinks and be careful when using public water fountains.
Thank you for your continued efforts to keep our students and staff healthy and safe. We will send additional information as it is available and needed.
Respectfully,

J Michael McClaren
Interim Superintendent, Caney Valley Schools

a.aria-label: Read more about Coronavirus Disease 2019-2020 (COVID-19) and other Communicable Diseases

h3.a: Coronavirus (COVID-19) Frequently Asked Questions for Students and Parents

p.span: Coronavirus (COVID-19) Frequently Asked Questions for Students and Parents

div.p: • How do I communicate with my Principal, Teacher, or Counselor if I need to talk to them?

Email is the best mode of communication at this time. No one is in the buildings to answer phones.
❏ Travis Lashbrook - HS Principal - tlashbrook@caneyvalleyschool.org
❏ Susan Dawson - HS Administrative Assistant - sdawson@caneyvalleyschool.org
❏ Derek Scheihing - MS Principal - dscheihing@caneyvalleyschool.org
❏ Diane Moses - MS Administrative Assistant - dmoses@caneyvalleyschool.org
❏ Morgan Marquette - HS/MS Counselor - mmarquette@caneyvalleyschool.org
❏ Kelli Longan - Elem. Principal - klongan@caneyvalleyschool.org
❏ Virginia Fogle - Elem. Administrative Assistant - vfogle@caneyvalleyschool.org
❏ Mary Butterfield - Elementary Counselor/District Social Worker mbutterfield@caneyvalleyschool.org
*All teacher emails can be found on the school website.

• Will the school serve breakfast/lunch while the school is closed?
Yes, We will have a “grab and go” style that will be available for pick up (for any child 18 and under) from both campuses from 9:30-10:30 am.

• Will the school still have state tests and the ACT?
No, state tests have been canceled.

p.br:
• What will happen regarding my student's attendance?
Since school has shut down, all absences since the shutdown will not count against them.

div.p:
• What about all class activities/events such as MS dance, prom, graduation, and elementary carnival?
We are working on this and awaiting direction as to how to handle each specific activity/event.
• My child has daily prescription medication at the school. Will it be available for pickup?
If your child has daily prescription medication at the school, please contact the building administrator.

• Do IEP and evaluation meetings need to be held during the closure, and if so, are those held on campus or virtually?
No one is allowed on campus for any type of meeting. We are looking for direction from the State Department of Education on how to proceed.

• If schools remain closed, will there be any virtual days or instruction provided to students?
Yes, our teachers will work diligently to have this prepared. If we get the green light from the State Department of Education to move forward with instruction, we will do so.

• How do I know as a parent if a student is tested positive with the coronavirus?
The Health Department must notify the school and then the school would notify the community. Due to confidentiality laws, we would not name the student or staff member but would instead just make a general statement, making the community aware.

• Will students have to make up the days missed due to school closure?
No.

div.p: Caney Valley School is excited to announce that we now have a fully functioning App that patrons can use to get up to the minute push notifications related to our school. Users of the app will also have access to their e-funds accounts, calendars, contact numbers, and more. Patrons can add the app to their device by going to their web store and searching "Caney Valley Schools". Alternatively, when accessing the Caney Valley School Website from their mobile device they will be prompted to download the app. . . .

a.aria-label: Read more about Caney Valley School App

div.p:
Sign up for News Updates at the Caney Valley Web Site and get e-mail updates on events at Caney Valley Schools. When subscribing to an Email List you will receive an email to confirm if you wish to join – make sure you respond to it to be added.
It is quick and easy, you can click on this link /vnews/display.v?page=vlist_signup to sign up. The link can also be found on any of the sub pages of the school web site. /
The link will take you to this page, choose all that apply.
When subscribing to an Email List you will receive an email to confirm if you wish to join – make sure you respond to it to be added. Update - if you do not get the "confirm" e-mail check your spam folder.

a.aria-label: Read more about Sign Up for E-Mail Alerts

div.p:
Inclement Weather
CANEY VALLEY PUBLIC SCHOOLS
INCLEMENT WEATHER PROCEDURES DURING THE SCHOOL DAY
In preparation of a potential weather event during a school day, we have prepared the following procedures to ensure our student’s safety and ease the minds of parents and guardians. Your child’s safety is our ultimate goal.
We will notify the parents/guardians through the following:
Our school website: www.caneyvalleyschool.org
TV Stations:
Channel 2 -- KJRH Channel 6 – KOTV Channel 8 -- KTUL
Radio Stations:
KVOO – FM 95 – Tulsa KFAQ—AM 1170—Tulsa KICK--FM 99.1 – Tulsa KYFM--FM100.1 – Bartlesville KWON – AM 1400—Bartlesville KRIG—104.9--Bartlesville . . .
